instructions.objective: Provide a concise overview of the solution being offered from the source document, highlighting its technical foundation, key features, and overall benefits to the client. Do not explain client responsibilities, risks, and methodologies in this specific section.

Highlight the core business value the product offers, clearly outlining the specific benefits clients will gain by adopting the solution. Do not explain client responsibilities, risks, and methodologies in this specific section.
instructions.format: Introductory sentence followed by a numbered list with brief, persuasive explanations

instructions.objective: Summarize relevant content from source to explain why the company is a suitable partner or provider. Do not explain client responsibilities, risks, and methodologies in this specific section.

Clearly enumerate the scope of work for implementing the proposed solution, breaking down each major activity into distinct phases. For each phase, list 3 to 5 detailed, action-oriented bullet points that describe specific tasks, deliverables, and outcomes. Focus on what will be done and how, using active verbs. Exclude client responsibilities, risks, and methodologies.
instructions.format: Numbered list of 4 to 6 key activities, each with 3 to 4 enumerated, action-oriented deliverables in bullet points

instructions.objective: An introductory sentence that briefly explains the purpose of presenting the methodologies. Next, enumerate the two methodologies (Agile-Driven and Phased Waterfall) as a numbered list. Under each methodology, enumerate the major steps involved in that methodology in bullet points with a brief explanation of each step.
instructions.format: An introductory sentence that briefly explains the purpose of presenting the methodologies. Next, The methodologies as numbered lists and the major steps for each methodology as bullet points.

instructions.objective: Enumerate the Points of Contact (i.e., Technical Lead, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Client Stakeholders) along with their respective roles and responsibilities in bullet points. Then, in a separate list, outline the communication plan (i.e., Kickoff Meeting, Weekly Meetings, Milestone Review) with corresponding frequency for each meeting or review.
instructions.format: An introductory sentence and then numbered lists for the Points of Contact and Communication Plan. Bullet points for items enumerated in each numbered list items.

instructions.objective: Provide a formal list of assumptions necessary for the successful implementation of the solution being offered. Begin with a one-sentence introduction, then present each assumption as a numbered list item with a title (e.g., Client Collaboration and Support, System Access and Integration). Under each item, provide sub-bullets explaining the key assumptions in concise sentences.
instructions.format: An introductory sentence followed by numbered list items with sub-bullets for each assumption.

instructions.objective: Provide a formal list of risks and their mitigation strategies.
instructions.format: Numbered list items of risks with bullet points enumerating the corresponding mitigation strategies.
